poem:
Title: "An Ode to Complacency"

In the break of dawn, we wade, blasé amidst rising tide,
Skirting tides of frailty, born through heedless human pride.
Warnings echo, unheeded, dance with specters unseen,
One in twenty-four, yet still in isolation we dream.
Sleepwalking sans visage, amidst battlegrounds of breath,
Oracles howl advice, shrill to ears tuned to death.
